TopicTitle: Next additions to the Kerbol System?

Articles.Content:
Any ideas about what will be coming in future updates? I'm most excited to see other star systems, but I don't expect that for a long time.

What other planets would you guys like to see? Personally, I'd like to see another planet like Kerbin or a Moon line Laythe, with liquid and a thinner atmosphere.

I'd also like to see another Planet like Jool, with many moons. Maybe Eeloo will finally get a home (even though I like it where it is currently).
I was thinking something more along the lines of a real-ish asteroid belt.
I do remember that we got a teaser pic for a new gas giant a short while back. Eeloo and a few other moons will orbit it.
I rather like that gas giant (ice giant?,) there's nothing quite like it in the Kerbolar system currently.

they should add a saturn like planet with a huge and obvious belt.

and we can actually crash into the things in the belt (ice or rock or whatever) to kill our kerbals
+1 for a gas giant with a physical ring around it! Would be the coolest place for screenshots

The problem with doing a Saturn analog is that the ring would be difficult to render.

It's easy to just make a ring texture with transparency from far away, but when you get in close it has to transition smoothly into millions of pieces of debris.
Or, you know, in a shocking twist, have the ring be a solid disc. I know it does not make sense, but hey.

...but when you get in close it has to transition smoothly into millions of pieces of debris.

Which would be loaded like "parts". Imagine bringing a +500 part mothership near that belt.

People don't seem to take that into account. I'm talking to you, lammatt.

Back OT, I think it'd be another (ringless) gas giant. Until the Devs figure out how to render a ring without killing our computers, there won't be any Saturn analogs.

Edited September 6, 2013 by astropapi1
Couldn't they use decals? I mean, rings are flat so it could work. You'd just pass right through it.

Particles would not look good at many distances, using superposed rings with transparency would give a good illusion of thickness and complexity at a sufficient distance for good performance but would fail when "inside" the ring, individually managing every boulder and rock, or even individual flights of boulders and rocks in the rings, would be plain impossible.

Couldn't they use decals? I mean, rings are flat so it could work. You'd just pass right through it.

That would look terrible up close though. Even with KSP's downscaled universe, they should be a couple hundred meters thick at least.

If the rings don't look good and you can't fly around in them, what is the point of having them?

I would honestly like to see a "Moon of a Moon" For example say and object slightly smaller than Gilly on and inclined orbit around Ike or Tylo. Please Squad...

Edited August 7, 2013 by TheTriniFlyer

I agree that having just a flat surface for rings would be a bad idea. KSP is about exploration just as much as it is about spaceflight, so if they're going to include rings I would like it done properly or not at all.

Freelancer had those tiny little pebbles floating in space. They were nothing but decals - much like particles we already got with flaming out engines or the kethane-miners. Theyre basically a small 2d-picture thats always facing the camera while floating around/falling to the ground.

I bet Harvey will have it this way. Most games use them for tasks like this one.
Lock the Casbah.

Failing that I'd like either a Neptune analog, or some vulcanoid asteroids near the sun.
